intro: Chaenorhinum rubrifolium f. rupestre, commonly known as the red-leaved chaenorhinum, is a compact, herbaceous plant characterized by its vivid red foliage. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is native to rocky or arid environments. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging growing conditions.
